summary:
The document outlines the procedural details and requirements for a public procurement process related to the acquisition of traffic paint, as part of a public investment project. Issued on June 27, 2019, by the Subgerencia de Obras Públicas, the document is part of an activity linked to the maintenance of horizontal signage.

The memorandum, identified as N* 195-2019-MDLM, details the various stages of the requirement process, including multiple versions that were revised due to observations and feedback. These revisions were made both officially and in response to specific observations, indicating a thorough review process to ensure the requirement's accuracy and completeness.

The document also addresses whether the procurement will include packages or be conducted by items, with a decision pending based on technical justification from the user area or the contracting body. It notes that no standardization process has been carried out for this procurement, implying that the acquisition will be tailored to specific needs rather than following a pre-established standard.

The requirement details are further elaborated in Chapter III of the Specific Section of the Bases, which likely contains technical specifications and other critical information for potential suppliers. The document also includes a summary of communications and responses between the user area and the Office of Economic Control (OEC), as well as with suppliers, highlighting the collaborative nature of the procurement process.

The market investigation phase began on an unspecified date in 2019 and concluded on August 26, 2019. This phase aimed to identify a plurality of suppliers capable of meeting the procurement requirements, ensuring competitive and efficient contracting.

Overall, the document reflects a structured approach to public procurement, emphasizing thorough review, stakeholder communication, and market analysis to achieve effective and efficient acquisition of necessary materials.
